properties.name: 120 E. Taylor St.,
properties.description: Posted by Yfz123 Phoenix, AZWhere all my JMC110 students live and where I go to get coffee every morning.

properties.name: 200 E. Van Buren
properties.description: Posted by Yfz123 Phoenix, AZArizona Republic where I work one or two nights a week, depending on when they need me.

properties.name: 222 E. Monroe
properties.description: Posted by Yfz123 Phoenix, AZHerberger Center, where I\'ve seen some plays. I pass it every day.

properties.name: 455 N. 3rd St.
properties.description: Posted by Yfz123 Phoenix, AZArizona Center, where I do some of my eating and some of my shopping.

properties.name: 555 N. Central
properties.description: Posted by Yfz123 Phoenix, AZWalter Cronkite School of Journalism, my home away from home.

properties.name: 601 N. 6th Ave.
properties.description: Posted by Yfz123 Phoenix, AZ

properties.name: Deblin, Poland
properties.description: Posted by Yfz123 This is where Trudy was born in December 1923. She lived with her parents and three siblings, Rose, Alan and Barney.

properties.name: Ellis Island
properties.description: Posted by Yfz123 Ellis Island, New YorkTrudy and her family came into the United States through Ellis Island. Bu her account, it was noisy, crowded, and entailed a lot of waiting. But she was so happy to be in America.

properties.name: Fashion Plate
properties.description: Posted by Yfz123 Trudy worked in retail for a few years at this now out-of-business clothing store in the Chicago Loop.

properties.name: First Apartment
properties.description: Posted by Yfz123 The first place Trudy and her family lived when they arrived in Chicago.

properties.name: Fourth Apartment
properties.description: Posted by Yfz123 Trudy\'s fourth and current apartment, where she still lives with my mother.

properties.name: Germany
properties.description: Posted by Yfz123 After the war, Trudy, along with my grandfather, Herbert, traveled through Germany on their way out of Europe. It was here that my aunt Rozelle was born in 1950.

properties.name: Miami
properties.description: Posted by Yfz123 Miami, FlordiaTrudy often traveled here with her family over the years for vacations, and now goes once a year for a reunion for people who grew up in her town in Poland.

properties.name: Second Apartment
properties.description: Posted by Yfz123 The second apartment Trudy and her family lived in. Also where my mother, Loretta, grew up.

properties.name: Third Apartment
properties.description: Posted by Yfz123 Trudy and her family lived here briefly in the 1970s.

properties.name: Walter Cronkite School of Journalism and Mass Communications
properties.description: Posted by Yfz123 555 N. Central Ave.My school, where I spend (at least) five days a week.

properties.name: Work Camp
properties.description: Posted by Yfz123 During World War II, Trudy and her family were forced from their homes and taken to a work camp somewhere in Poland. She is not sure of the exact location, but she knows it was far from Deblin. Though they were forced to undertake extreme manual labor and endure horrible living conditions, they managed to survive until the camp was liberated by the Russians.
